Dear Mr. Mossberg:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/16/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP (Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan) and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(b) Documentation that the foster parent is willing to accept
the foster child.
One of 1 borrowed foster home did not have documentation that the foster parent is
willing to accept the foster child.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(e) A list of all children currently placed in the home.
One of 1 borrowed foster home did not have a list of all children in the foster home.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One of 1 borrowed foster home did not have documentation that the foster parent
has received orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed by
the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One of 1 borrowed foster home did not have a copy of the foster parent /agency
agreement signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
4

R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(3) An agency shall complete a special evaluation within 45
calendar days after receipt of the information. If additional time
is required, then the agency shall inform the foster parent, in
writing, of the basis for the extension and the expected length of
the extension. The total time for the completion of the
investigation shall not exceed 90 calendar days without written
approval from the chief administrator or his or her designee.
One of 3 foster home special evaluations reviewed exceeded the 45 calendar day
timeframe without a written notice to the foster parent that the special evaluation
would take more than 45 calendar days. This is a repeat violation from the 2018
Renewal Inspection with an approved CAP on 10/04/2018
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service plan
must address the living arrangement for the child or children,
visitation/parenting time with the youth's biological children or a
clear explanation why this is not possible or appropriate.
Two of 32 service plans reviewed went beyond the require 90 calendar days of the
above rules. One was 1 day beyond the rule and the other was 3 days.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
SRM 200 FINGERPRINTS
11 of 16 Personnel Training
All personnel, contractors, vendors and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete security
awareness training (SAT). Training will be available on the
Learning Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel
and contractors with access to this system.
5

SAT is required to be taken within six months of being in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes the SAT. DCWL consultants will monitor
completion of SAT in all CPAs as part of the annual licensing
audit.
Seven of 10 employees required to complete Security Awareness Training (SAT)
failed to have re-training within the two-year time frame.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The interim inspection completed on
09/25/2019 with a corrective action plan approved on 10/30/2019 cited the following:
 CPA212 (b) Verification of education
 CPA212 (d) three references
 CPA418 (2)(a) timeliness of ISP
 CPA418 (2)(b) timeliness of USP
 CPA502 Copy of Independent Living Program Statement to youth
 CPA503 Copy of Independent Living Policies to youth
 ISEP 6.33 Service plans signed bt the parties
 Policy FOM722-064 Five days to enter contacts into MiSACWIS
 Policy FOM722-08 ISP approved by supervisor within 14 days
 Policy FOM722-09 USP approved by supervisor within 14 days
 Policy FOM722-034 Sibling splits documented in PER
 Policy FOM801 Medical authorization to provider
 Policy FOM722-03D DHS-69 not loaded into MiSACWIS
There were no repeat violations.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
